modName: Touched By Dibella - Standalone Vanilla Armors Clothing
summary: This is a standalone plugin for vanilla armors/clothing converted for the TBD body.
descriptionHtml:
[CENTER][URL=https://flic.kr/p/niW8YP][IMG]https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7416/13986435451_3043c112cd_z.jpg[/IMG][/URL][/CENTER]
[CENTER][B][FONT=Times New Roman][COLOR=#c0504d][SIZE=7]Description[/SIZE][/COLOR][/FONT][/B][/CENTER]
This is a standalone plugin for vanilla armors & clothing converted for the Touched by Dibella body.

*In other words a separate set of armors and clothing meshes that use the Touched by Dibella meshes, renamed accordingly.

All armor and clothing currently apart of the plugin will have the prefix, "Dibella" in front of the actual name of the armor. This is to make it easier to differentiate these meshes from the default meshes (or meshes used for UNP/CBBE/ADEC/other bodies).

All armor and clothing is craftable. Clothing is craftable at the tanning rack, and yes, each piece of clothing uses the exact same materials.

Most armors will be craftable at the standard Smithing Forge. The Blades Armor and Savior's Hide are craftable at the Skyforge. You will find the armors under different categories such as Hide, Leather, Daedric, Dwarven, Ebony, Faction, Steel, etc.

Clothing will be found under clothing at the Tanning Rack.

*The Thieves Guild armors will require completing the quests in order to craft them. The Leader armor will require completing the Thieves Guild quest for becoming leader. The Thieves Guild variant armors will require joining the Thieves Guild.

*The Ebony Mail will also require completing the Boethiah quest for obtaining the actual Ebony Mail in order to craft it.

*The Dark Brotherhood armor will require joining the Dark Brotherhood in order to craft it.


[CENTER][B][COLOR=#c0504d][SIZE=7][FONT=Times New Roman]Requirements[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR][/B][/CENTER]
Skyrim.esm is all that is currently required. When Dawnguard and Dragonborn armors are converted, they will be created with their own separate plugins for those without the DLC.


[CENTER][B][COLOR=#c0504d][SIZE=7][FONT=Times New Roman]Installation[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR][/B][/CENTER]
Manual installation is a rather simple process. Copy the provided meshes folder and the TouchedByDibellaVanilla.esp to the Data directory of your Skyrim installation. Activate the esp and you're set.

You should be able to add the file in the compressed form to an install manager (Mod Organizer, NMM, Wyre Bash, etc.)

[CENTER][B][COLOR=#c0504d][SIZE=7][FONT=Times New Roman]Credits[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR][/B][/CENTER]

[URL=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/5487668]themilkdrinker[/URL] - Author of the [URL=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53135/?]Touched by Dibella[/URL] body and converted vanilla meshes for the body.
Bethesda - Creation Kit tool.
DarkF0X127 - For his [URL=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GFoIl27xk0U]tutorial[/URL] on BBcode for Nexus and Hot Editor site reference.
author: Cosmosis1 -The Milkdrinker
